Detailed Description

represents a logical rank and associated statistics

Member Function Documentation

Command * Rank::getCommand ( const unsigned  thisBank  ) 

get the next command in the queue for this bank

simply return the command for this bank if it is not a refresh all command otherwise remove the refresh all commands from all the other queues, assuming there is a refresh all command at the head of each, else return null

Author:
Joe Gross
Parameters:
thisBank the ordinal of the bank to get the next command for (0..n)
Returns:
the next command to be issued for this bank

tick Rank::getPrechargeTime ( const tick  currentTime  )  const

get the total length of time that this rank had all banks precharged since the last reset

Returns:
cycles all banks are precharged

tick Rank::getTotalPrechargeTime ( const tick  currentTime  )  const

get the total length of time that this rank had all banks precharged

Returns:
cycles all banks are precharged

bool Rank::refreshAllReady (  )  const

is there a refresh command ready at each per bank queue

if there is a refresh all command at the head of each per bank queue, then the next command for this rank is a refresh all banks command
this is signified by inserting a refresh all command into the tail of each queue and removing them when they all reach the front
this is done to ensure that a refresh command will never disturb an open row that has a waiting CAS, as the refresh command will ruin the row

Author:
Joe Gross
Returns:
true if all queue heads have refresh all commands

void Rank::resetToTime ( const tick  time  ) 

update this rank to seem like time started at a nonzero time

used when the simulator has fast forwarded to a certain time and then begun detailed simulation. this function will avoid giving too large/small values after a simple->detailed switch
